title: Can we give Annie the Corki treatment???
body: By the Corki Treatment I mean making her Tibbers an actual skillshot with an actual missile that you can dodge, and obviously the increased range to help her make big plays. Not only does it add another layer of counterplay to Annie's snowbally and incredibly bursty kit, it fits together thematically and lets face it, who wouldn't love throwing a cuddly teddy bear at your lane opponent to kill them?

replies.body:
While I like the ability to counter spells, I think Annie's ult makes sense as it is.
So recently Corki's Q and even now Viegar's event horizon have been changed so that there is a delay between when it appears and when the dmg/cc is appied; I feel this is justified as they aren't ultimate's. They are just normal abilities with relatively shorter cooldowns. If not easily counterable they can result in heavily lane advantage. 

An ultimate however is meant to be big and scary. 
Most time the only way Annie can get a good ult off is with a flash. 
So although the ult cd itself is about 60 seconds, the flash timer is significantly longer.
This is the current counterplay to Annie.
If you wished to make the longer range, in compensation for it not being instant, you would have an Annie who would have the potential to get off A LOT more good ults. 
Increasing the range would be too much of a buff, compared to the smaller debuff that would be the delay.

Ehh.. I don't know. For me personally, anything that doesn't have counterplay or isn't too hard to pull off shouldn't be too strong, ult or no. Tibbers+Stun is really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really really strong.

The counterplay still exist, it's just not a direct side step.

In a fight against this, your team can and SHOULD, "group but not stick", meaning they can position such a way that an Annie ult would only hit one person. I know this can be hard to pull off in a solo queue game but if said in chat it should be possible to at least make Annie only stun two people.

With majority of your team unstunned then;
1. Carry stunned;  Tanks/Support should have some cc to follow up on her, before she learns a combo, and another damage dealer should be quickly kill her. 
2. She stuns the peel; you should be able to get significant trade damage while unstunned, regardless of whether she invests the rest of the combo on you or on your peel.

In terms of nuking Annie, she will either be support and should die without the need of the damager dealer ultimate, if she is a mid or top she is worth the expenditure of the other damager dealer's ultimate. 

If both your damage dealer's got stunned, you got outplayed! Plain a simple.
If you wish to counter Annie you need to ensure you coordinate your team so that both damage dealer will not be stunned. This is what in game chat should be used for. 

Annie is high-risk, high reward. 
She is fragile, with no escape, particularly if she's flashed in. 
To balance this is has the high reward of an instant AOE stun.

Counterplay should not be balanced around summoner spells being up or down. This sucks for Annie when her flash is on cooldown, and sucks for everyone else when it is available.

Make it dodgeable, then up the range to 800 or 900 (1190-1290 effective range at the edge of tibbers spawn damage radius). Now Annie feels better because she doesn't rely on a massive cooldown summoner spell to make plays, and everyone else feels better because they can actually dodge it somewhat. Don't forget she can still flash incinerate if the instant stun is needed versus the larger diameter stun.
